name: Seoul Palace Hotel

reviews.text: Seoul Palace hotel is very clean and a good hotel for the price. Asiarooms had the best rate that I could find anywhere. The staff is very helpful and friendly. They have 3 computers in the lobby for free internet access. The hotel is located in Kangnam, which is a very upper-scale neighborhood. Within walking distance is the Kangnam bus terminal, which is a major stop for all buses and subway. Co-located with Kangnam terminal is the Shinsegae dept. store and the lower subway tunnels have tons of food and shops. Find your way to the subway entrance area and there is a restaurant called Myungin Mandoo. It's really cheap and they have really good mandoo (dumplings) and ddukboki. 3 of us ate and walked out for under $12 dollars. Among all the shops, there is a floor level dedicated (outside of Shinsegae dept. store) to making curtains, bedsheets and blanket covers. It's just a fun place to walk around and people-see.
reviews.title: Good 3 star hotel

likes.disliked: — Not in the middle of food and stores. You have to walk across busy street about 5 minutes

reviews.text: The KAL limo-bus drops you off right in front of the hotel from ICN airport. In fact, it's the first hotel stop from the airport. The bad part is that it's the first pickup stop when going TO the airport and therefore, you must ride along for the next 5 hotel pick up stops. This adds an additional 45 minutes to your return trip back to the airport. One hour from ICN to the hotel and 1:45 from hotel to ICN. If you're flying KAL into Korea, buy your KAL limo passes on the airplane. It's about $4 cheaper per roundtrip ticket than if you buy it at the airport upon landing. Overall, I was very satisfied with the hotel. If staying in Kangnam area again, I would stay there. Of course, you can't beat Lotte hotel for location and service, but that's a few hundred dollars more, too.
reviews.title: Great Service

likes.disliked: — Lack of English instructions for bidet

reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Seoul Palace Hotel for six nights. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was very adequate, clean and comfortable. Complimentary breakfasts had plenty of variety to meet most needs. Thank you for your great service. Only complaint - instructions for use of bidet should also be in English.
reviews.title: ENJOYABLE STAY

likes.liked: — Was nice, clean and friendly service

description: Seoul Palace Hotel is a 5-minute walk from Exit No.5 .subway line 3, 7, 9 Express Bus Terminal Station. It features a fitness club, sauna and 6 dining options.Central City Shopping Mall is a 5-minute walk from Seoul Palace Hotel while a 5-minute journey on foot brings guests to Seorae Village. Recreation options at Banpo section of Han River Park are just a 3-minute car journey away.Rooms come with both air-conditioning and heating facilities. Each room has internet access, LCD cable TV, a minibar, a Safety box, a Bathtub and a Bidet . Bathrobe and slippers are provided.Seoul Palace has a business centre for guests to work in. Parking is available on site. The hotel also provides laundry and dry cleaning services.The Stone Plate serves Korean and international cuisine. Chinese menu can be found at Suh Goong Restaurant, Japanese dishes are available at Ta bong Restaurant and drinks are served at Bar Gusto.
